question: Which of the following is known as State bird of Madhya Pradesh?
explanation:
Asian Paradeise also called ‘Dudhraj’ or ‘Shah Bulbul’ in local launguage is the state bird of Madhya Pradesh.Least concern in IUCN list.
Great Indian Bustard is the state bird of Rajasthan state.It is found in Western India nad adjoining parts of Pakistan.It comes under Critically rare in IUCN list.
Indian roller is the state bird for Bihar,Karnataka and Odisha state and is found in large part of asian subcontinent.Least concern in IUCN list.
Hill myna is the state bird of Meghalaya and Chhattishgarh state and is under Least concern in IUCN list.
